name: Broiled Tilapia Fish Tacos with Cilantro-Lime Slaw
author: Kristy
summary: This is my own recipe that I developed after trying several other recipes. These tilapia fish tacos are quick, easy, and delicious. My family loves them! Garnish with diced tomato, corn, avocado, red onion, and Mexican cheese.
ingredients: ¼ teaspoon ground ancho chile powder
directions: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
Line a baking pan with aluminum foil
Combine Greek yogurt, mayonnaise, lime juice, onion, vinegar, cilantro, hot sauce, salt, and ancho chile powder in a bowl
Stir in shredded cabbage to make the slaw
Place tilapia fillets on the prepared baking pan
Combine cumin, paprika, salt, and garlic powder in another bowl
Sprinkle spice mixture over the fish
Bake under the preheated broiler until fish flakes easily with a fork, 8 to 10 minutes
Place tortillas between 2 damp paper towels
Warm in the microwave, 1 to 2 minutes
Spoon the cooked tilapia onto each tortilla and top with the slaw
